data.description:
## Problem
ID prefix conventions are scattered across multiple files with no single source of truth:
- cortical/utils/id_generation.py (generate_* functions)
- cortical/got/types.py (entity classes)
- Various usages throughout codebase

Issues found:
1. E- prefix collision: Both Edge and Epic use E- (though Epic prefers EPIC-)
2. Sprint ID format inconsistency: S-NNN vs S-sprint-NNN-name
3. No documented prefix → entity_type mapping
4. No collision prevention specification

## Solution
Create authoritative documentation:

### 1. Create docs/got-namespace-specification.md
```markdown
# GoT Namespace Specification

## ID Prefixes (Authoritative)
| Prefix | Entity Type | Format | Example |
|--------|-------------|--------|---------|
| T- | Task | T-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXX | T-20251226-141000-a1b2c3d4 |
| D- | Decision | D-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXX | D-20251226-141000-e5f6g7h8 |
| S- | Sprint | S-NNN | S-026 |
| EPIC- | Epic | EPIC-{name} | EPIC-got-db |
| H- | Handoff | H-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXX | H-20251226-141000-q1r2s3t4 |
| E- | Edge | E-{source}-{target}-{type} | E-S-026-T-xxx-CONTAINS |

## Reserved Prefixes
| Prefix | Reserved For |
|--------|--------------|
| E- | Edge ONLY (not Epic) |
| CML-, CMV-, TEAM-, PP-, DOC-, G-, OP-, EX- | Extended entities |
```

### 2. Add validation function
```python
def validate_id_format(entity_id: str, expected_type: str) -> bool:
    '''Validate ID matches expected entity type.'''
    ...
```

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Single authoritative document for all ID conventions
2. Validation function to detect malformed IDs
3. CLAUDE.md references the specification
4. CI check for ID format violations
data.title: Document namespace conventions comprehensively
